name: mastodon
content:

a large animal similar to an elephant, but with fur, that existed on the Earth until around 10,000 years ago: Mammoths, mastodons, sloth, and bison roamed the land. Ten thousand years ago, Missouri's primitive hunters would band together to stalk the American mastodon.
Peter Visscher/Dorling Kindersley RF/Getty Images /GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesMastodons, which also resembled elephants, generally preferred wetter, more woodsy environments.Bones and teeth of a juvenile mastodon were discovered in Heinze Cave in the 1970s.Unfortunately for the mammoths, mastodons and sloths in America, the first humans they encountered were professional hunters.
